Clip.Title: JEFFERSON'S SECRET BIBLE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Experts at Smithsonian Institution's National Museum of American History are trying 200 years later, to preserve Jefferson's secret bible, a book he constructed by cutting apart the New Testament to tell a chronological story of Jesus's life, parables, and moral instruction, removing all mention of miracles and the resurrection.

Clip.Title: SHACKLETON'S FROZEN HELL
Clip.EpisodeSummary: In 1914, the world's first trans-Antarctic expedition came to a cold stop. Trapped in ice just 60 miles from their destination, explorer Ernest Shackleton and his crew found themselves in a dire situation that would play out as a two-year battle against starvation, sub-zero conditions, and the threat of being swallowed by the unforgiving Southern Ocean.

Clip.Title: THE SILK ROAD
Clip.Episode: The Flame and Cross: The South Caucasus
Clip.EpisodeSummary: 25 years after first filming the route, the original film crew returns to the region for a modern look.

Clip.Title: JEFFERSON'S SECRET BIBLE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Experts at Smithsonian Institution's National Museum of American History are trying 200 years later, to preserve Jefferson's secret bible, a book he constructed by cutting apart the New Testament to tell a chronological story of Jesus's life, parables, and moral instruction, removing all mention of miracles and the resurrection.

Clip.Title: SKY VIEW
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Soar over Europe and experience the landscape from an eagle's perspective. This remarkable series uses the latest HD and camera mount technology to give the audience a view of Europe and its history that will takes their breath away.

Clip.Title: SKY VIEW
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Soar over Europe and experience the landscape from an eagle's perspective. This remarkable series uses the latest HD and camera mount technology to give the audience a view of Europe and its history that will takes their breath away.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: High above the Gulf of St. Lawrence, one of the East Coast's hidden wonders lies below - the Magdalene Islands - offering some of the region's top beaches, grassy hillsides and spectacular cliff faces.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The Eastern Coastline of Nova Scotia is a living historical record of the centuries-old battle between the French and the English in the New World, along one of the Atlantic's most remote, hostile coastlines.

Clip.Title: COSMIC VISTAS
Clip.Episode: Windows to Other Worlds - Fountain of Creation
Clip.EpisodeSummary: How humans discovered the planets and how a few moving lights in the sky became a rich and complex solar system.

Clip.Title: COSMIC VISTAS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Mercury offers us a look at a solid world and the forces that shape it. With substantially more matter and a thicker atmosphere, Venus tells an even more complex story.

Clip.Title: QUEST
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Covering developments in astronomy, biology, chemistry, engineering, the environment, geology, health, physics and the weather, Quest delves deep into subject matter that is often inaccesible to the public, to satisfy your curiousity and to illuminate the wonders of contemporary science and research.

Clip.Title: QUEST
Clip.Episode: Future Firefighters & Improving Life for Darfur Refugees
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Covering developments in astronomy, biology, chemistry, engineering, the environment, geology, health, physics and the weather, Quest delves deep into subject matter that is often inaccesible to the public, to satisfy your curiousity and to illuminate the wonders of contemporary science and research.

Clip.Title: HUMAN ORIGINS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: More than 285 early-human fossils and artifacts from 48 different countries tell the story our six-million-year-old history.

Clip.Title: EXTREME CLERGY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Despite threats, Father Daniel Vogt stands with Mexico's native Quechi as they struggle to acquire legal title to their ancestral land.

Clip.Title: EXTREME CLERGY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Rev John Fife scours the desert giving aid to undocumented migrants crossing into America through the life-endangering Sonora Desert.

Clip.Title: ALL ABOARD
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Travel across the entire island of Sicily by train and uncover some cultural history along the way.

Clip.Title: FAMILY PORTRAIT IN BLACK AND WHITE
Clip.Episode: Family Portrait in Black and White
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Olga Nenya has 27 children. Four of them, now adults, are her biological children; the other 23 are adopted or foster children. Of those 23, 16 are bi-racial. She calls them "my chocolates," and is raising them to be patriotic Ukrainians.

Clip.Title: ORPHANS OF TIBET
Clip.EpisodeSummary: See how Tibetan children secretly flee their homeland over the Himalayas to reach schools in India.

Clip.Title: ALL ABOARD
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Travel across the entire island of Sicily by train and uncover some cultural history along the way.
